attributes.comment:
While I understand the government fee needs to be adjusted based on workload,
budgeting and inflation trend. I am still surprised to see such as large jump of
application fee, specially I-485. For a middle class employed by big corporation,
one time application fee increase is unlikely to impact the living standard. But
since many of immigrates are from third-world country, $905 application might be
worth one year of their family income. That burden is too much. My opinion is: If
we have to adjust the fee structure, we should do it in phased period and should
allow certain hardship application. Thanks.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Steven
